categories.description: Stimulate tactile senses through safe material exploration

activities.objective: Stimulate tactile senses through safe material exploration
activities.explanation: Provide a tray with different safe materials (e.g., silk, sponge). Baby explores textures with hands.

activity.name: Texture Tray Adventure
steps: Place 3-4 textured items in a tray
Supervise baby as they touch each item
Talk about each texture aloud
Use materials from our activity kit
Follow our step-by-step guide
Track progress on our tracking sheet
Return materials when activity is complete

activities.objective: Build tactile responsiveness and visual attention
activities.explanation: Create a sealed ziplock bag filled with gel and glitter. Baby squishes it while lying or sitting.

activity.name: Gel Bag Squish Play
steps: Fill a ziplock with gel and glitter
Seal and tape the edges tightly
Let baby squish and explore with hands

Follow our step-by-step guide
Track progress on our tracking sheet
Return materials when activity is complete

activities.explanation: Baby splashes hands in a shallow bowl with floating toys under supervision.

activity.name: Water Play Bowl

Use materials from our activity kit
Follow our step-by-step guide
Track progress on our tracking sheet
Return materials when activity is complete

activities.objective: Stimulate tactile feedback and crawling practice

activity.name: Textured Cloth Crawl
steps: Lay out a cloth path using fabrics with different textures
Place baby at one end of the path
Encourage crawling

Follow our step-by-step guide
Track progress on our tracking sheet
Return materials when activity is complete

activities.explanation: Use a basket filled with safe, natural items like pinecones, leaves, or cotton balls. Let baby explore safely.

categories.description: Strengthen neck and visual tracking through reflection

activities.explanation: Pick a toy and improve it with new features, usability, or safety.

activity.name: Toy Redesign Challenge
steps: Pick a common toy (e.g., spinner)
Identify what's missing
Sketch or prototype an improved version
Use materials from our activity kit
Follow our step-by-step guide
Track progress on our tracking sheet
Return materials when activity is complete

activities.explanation: Redesign a toddler toy for a teenager or vice versa.

activity.name: Toy for a Different Age
steps: Choose a toy meant for a different age
Reimagine it with added complexity or safety
Present your idea
Use materials from our activity kit
Follow our step-by-step guide
Track progress on our tracking sheet
Return materials when activity is complete

activities.objective: Build innovation from a real-life problem

Follow our step-by-step guide

activities.explanation: Design a toy for children with physical disabilities.

Creative.description: Activities involving artistic expression, imagination, storytelling, music, and creative problem-solving

age_appropriateness.Infant (0-1): Basic sensory exploration and cause-effect play
age_appropriateness.Toddler (1-3): Simple pretend play, scribbling, and basic building
age_appropriateness.Preschooler (3-5): Imaginative play, storytelling, and creative crafts
age_appropriateness.Child (6-8): Complex storytelling, art projects, and creative games
age_appropriateness.Pre-Teen (9-12): Advanced art techniques, music composition, and design thinking
age_appropriateness.Teen (13-18): Digital art, performance art, and innovative design projects

Cognitive.description: Activities that develop thinking skills, memory, attention, logical reasoning, and mental processing abilities

age_appropriateness.Infant (0-1): Basic cause-effect understanding and object permanence
age_appropriateness.Preschooler (3-5): Pattern recognition, sequencing, and memory games
age_appropriateness.Child (6-8): Complex problem-solving, strategy games, and logical thinking
age_appropriateness.Pre-Teen (9-12): Advanced reasoning, critical thinking, and analytical skills
age_appropriateness.Teen (13-18): Abstract thinking, complex problem-solving, and strategic planning

Sensory.description: Activities that stimulate and develop the five senses and sensory processing abilities

age_appropriateness.Toddler (1-3): Sensory play with different materials and textures
age_appropriateness.Child (6-8): Complex sensory activities and sensory discrimination
age_appropriateness.Pre-Teen (9-12): Advanced sensory processing and sensory art
age_appropriateness.Teen (13-18): Sophisticated sensory experiences and sensory design

Physical.description: Activities that develop gross and fine motor skills, coordination, balance, and physical abilities

age_appropriateness.Infant (0-1): Basic motor development and tummy time
age_appropriateness.Toddler (1-3): Walking, running, climbing, and basic coordination
age_appropriateness.Preschooler (3-5): Complex motor skills, balance, and coordination
age_appropriateness.Child (6-8): Advanced motor skills, sports, and physical games
age_appropriateness.Pre-Teen (9-12): Complex physical activities and team sports
age_appropriateness.Teen (13-18): Advanced physical skills, fitness, and athletic performance

Social.description: Activities that develop social skills, communication, teamwork, and interpersonal relationships

age_appropriateness.Infant (0-1): Basic social bonding and emotional connection
age_appropriateness.Toddler (1-3): Parallel play and basic social interaction
age_appropriateness.Preschooler (3-5): Cooperative play and social skills development
age_appropriateness.Child (6-8): Complex social interactions and friendship building
age_appropriateness.Pre-Teen (9-12): Advanced social skills and emotional intelligence
age_appropriateness.Teen (13-18): Complex social relationships and leadership skills

Emotional.description: Activities that develop emotional intelligence, self-regulation, empathy, and emotional awareness

age_appropriateness.Pre-Teen (9-12): Advanced emotional intelligence and peer relationships
age_appropriateness.Teen (13-18): Sophisticated emotional processing and identity development

Language.description: Activities that develop speaking, reading, vocabulary, communication, and language skills

age_appropriateness.Toddler (1-3): First words, simple sentences, and basic communication
age_appropriateness.Preschooler (3-5): Vocabulary expansion, storytelling, and pre-reading skills
age_appropriateness.Pre-Teen (9-12): Advanced language skills, creative writing, and presentation
age_appropriateness.Teen (13-18): Sophisticated language use, critical reading, and advanced communication

STEM.description: Activities that develop science, technology, engineering, and math concepts and skills

age_appropriateness.Preschooler (3-5): Number recognition, simple experiments, and building
age_appropriateness.Child (6-8): Basic math operations, simple science experiments, and engineering challenges
age_appropriateness.Pre-Teen (9-12): Advanced math concepts, technology use, and complex experiments
age_appropriateness.Teen (13-18): Advanced STEM concepts, programming, and innovative design

Practical.description: Activities that develop life skills, independence, daily tasks, and practical abilities

age_appropriateness.Toddler (1-3): Simple daily tasks and basic independence
age_appropriateness.Preschooler (3-5): More complex daily routines and responsibility
age_appropriateness.Pre-Teen (9-12): Complex practical skills and time management
age_appropriateness.Teen (13-18): Advanced life skills, career preparation, and adult independence

Adventure.description: Activities that involve exploration, discovery, outdoor experiences, and adventurous learning

age_appropriateness.Preschooler (3-5): Guided nature walks and simple treasure hunts
age_appropriateness.Pre-Teen (9-12): Complex outdoor activities and adventure challenges
age_appropriateness.Teen (13-18): Advanced adventure skills, leadership, and outdoor leadership
